ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: (instructor section) - Jonathan is very open for feedback and puts students first so that we get most out of the learning experience. - Great way to learn statistics! Thank you..
Reorganization of the notes to summarize the key points would be very useful.

This course covers a lot of material and moves at a fast pace, often to the detriment of a student's ability to reflect on and absorb that material. Just when you think, "Okay, I understand linear regression,"...zoom! It's off to the next topic.

Question 8: I believe that with enough time the professor can clearly explain concepts with extreme clarity and I found this when I met with him outside of class. However, due to the amount of material that the class needed to get through, the concepts at times were rushed and sometimes were not explained with great clarity. Question 10: I believe the professor has a great talent for teaching statistics in a way that is interesting and applicable to the field.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: - Flipped format for the class was very helpful. I could go back to the material and work during class an examples.
The ability to get more attention from the professor and to do more hands on learning of the stats we were learning by practicing them in class
Very practical and filed oriented. The material was given in an extremely easy way to digest; the course notes were very detailed and easy to read.
Learning how to use statistics software during class time.

Jonathan is an absolutely amazing professor. He is engaging and wants to help his students understand a subject that has difficult concepts and is pretty dry. He is so approachable outside of class. He is, hands down, my favorite professor from the semester.

I enjoyed the flipped aspect of the class, particularly having recorded videos on hand to review material. The regular homework assignments, too, provided an incentive to keep up with the pace of the class. The TAs and Jonathan were also very generous with their time outside of the class.
The flipped version allowed me to take my own pace. For me was extremely helpful to take this version of the class instead of the regular one.

The best aspects of the course were being able to make inferences with the data set after running statistical analysis and working with data that is relevant to the environmental field. I also thought the ability to learn in a computer lab and practice working on problem sets following the lectures was extremely beneficial to my learning.
Learning when to use different statistical tests.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: - The classwork covers a lot of things which is great, however it is very fast! I am not sure to have understood all the concepts completely compared to if the pace was slightly slower. However, the Professor points this out at the very first introduction class and offers during the class a review on the sections (for example before/after october break, etc). This was very helpful.
No improvements needed. The course instructor is open to feedback and everything we, as students shared personally, he seems to take seriously and eager to implement.
Summarizing notes.
I think everything ran pretty smoothly!
I would consider a review of the topics covered over the course of the semester and perhaps consider paring them down.
The quizzes are not very useful.

The concepts need to be connected in a more coherent way. I struggled to understand how each lecture was related to the last one and had issues seeing the big picture in order to know when to use which models or analysis. The lecture notes could be simplified heavily and they would be more accessible and easier to understand.
Pace of material. Map for when to use which statistical test should be discussed at the beginning instead of the end.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: - The homework was very useful, eventually it would be good to offer more exercises for people who would like to dive in more deeply (optional exercises on canvas/classesv2)

The discussion portion was helpful when we actually practiced the stats in class either by working on a few problems or practice using statistical program, Minitab, so that the stats we were learning were reinforced and projects/homework went smoother.
Excellent synergy between theory and practice in the computer lab with the statistical software Minitab.
More time spent learning how to use statistics on data rather than discussing questions in class.
I didn't go to any discussions or lab sections.

For the flipped course, the lecture and discussion was very intertwined and students were prepared to ask questions to clarify concepts learned in the video lectures. If the videos were put up earlier in the week, students would have more time and flexibility to watch the videos before class. The quizzes could be changed in between each trial in order to actually test the students' knowledge. I think the opportunity to ask questions regarding the video lectures in class before beginning problem sets was very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Great way to get an introduction into statistics. If working with data this class helps to orient and get a basic but firm knowledge on what tools to use and how to work with data.
The most valuable course this semester for setting a solid foundation and giving skills that can come useful at any time.
Integral to doing multivariate statistics next semester.

This course provides a statistical refresher for my masters work. I had taken one class of statistics during my undergraduate degree but many years have passed and I need to know how to perform statistical analysis for my research work.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: - important skill to have
I took this course because it gave me my own pace to learn and practice statistics which is I like better for my way of learning.
To revise my statistical knowledge, but I also learned a lot of new things while genuinely enjoying all the work.
I never had a great grasp on stats and I heard Jonathan was an excellent professor.
I wanted to become a more well-rounded environmental manager, capable of understanding basic statistical analyses.
In order to understand how to use statistics to answer environmental research questions of interest.
As a foundations class to better understand statistics used in other classes.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: - Yes, very much so.
Exceeds expectations.
yes.
Yes.
Yes, because after a couple of stats courses I feel that now I understand better.

Yes, my expectations were met for this course. However, I will most likely have to continue taking statistics to get the level of knowledge I will need for my research. I guess I did think that we would cover more in the course.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Definitely helps to work in groups and discuss together the concepts learned in class.
All group members were already well prepared and we managed to contribute equally well in the analysis of a statistical dataset.
Learning how others explain statistics.
Well it gave us the chance to work through problems together and from different backgrounds, so that was good.

There were many advantages to group work in this course. Working with other students helped me recognize what I understood and what concepts I needed to clarify through extra reading or meeting with the professor. It helped to go over problem sets together because sometimes other students would simply word things differently that can make more sense than when it was explained through the lecture.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: To get most out of it students should try their best to keep up with the speed and use the help offered by the professor and TA's to understand the material.
This course should be a must, no matter if students have taken statistics before.
Keep up with the material! It's a really fast-paced course.

I would buy a supplemental text because I found the notes difficult to follow. I would definitely attend the TA sessions and find a TA that seems to explain concepts in a way that resonates with your learning style. I would intentionally work on placing different concepts within the larger context of statistical analysis in order to understand how things fit together.
Taking the flipped version is helpful if you are not a strong auditory processor. Reunig-Scherer speaks quickly!
